Reduced Financial Inequality: The erasure of world debt could reduce financial inequality between countries. This would lead to a more equitable distribution of wealth and resources, promoting global economic stability.

Increased Consumer Spending: Without the burden of debt, consumers would have more disposable income to spend on goods and services. This would lead to increased consumer spending, which would stimulate economic growth.

Improved Global Trade: The erasure of world debt could lead to improved global trade. With more disposable income, countries would be more likely to import and export goods, leading to increased global trade and economic growth.

Reduced Government Spending: The erasure of world debt could lead to reduced government spending on debt repayment. This would free up resources for governments to invest in social programs, infrastructure, and other public goods.

Environmental Benefits: The erasure of world debt could lead to increased investment in renewable energy and environmental protection. With more disposable income, countries would be more likely to invest in sustainable development.
